intro: Uvariodendron connivens, commonly known as the African blackwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by edible, black, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its valuable timber and ornamental qualities, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
